name: DMPP-2
scenarioDescription:
The DMPP-2 Exoplanetary System


Overview

DMPP-2 is a star with 1.44 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.78 times its radius. It is located 437.05 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 2 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

DMPP-2 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the DMPP-2 system


DMPP-2 b

DMPP-2 b was discovered by the Multiple Facilities observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of DMPP-2 b is 138.966 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, DMPP-2 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system DMPP-2, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Multiple Facilities.
